author: Vijaita Singh
text:
A Belgian Malinois dog helped the National Security Guard (NSG) commandos gather key evidence from the airmen’s billet at the Pathankot airbase, which was blown up and where two more terrorists were said to be holed up. The confusion around the number of terrorists who hid inside the airbase still continues.

Rocky got burns on the left leg when he was sent inside the billet on January 4, to check whether there were any survivors, almost 12 hours after the building was blown up.

“Rocky went inside and dragged a pouch out of the rubble. The surface was still burning as a lot of explosions had taken place inside. We suspect that the pouch belonged to one of the two terrorists inside the billet. When we opened it, there was a grenade pin inside, it has been handed over to the NIA” said a top NSG official, who was part of the operations.

As reported by The Hindu , the presence of two more terrorists inside the airbase was detected only on January 3, more than 30 hours after the engagement with the first set of four terrorists started.

The January 2 attack on the air force base left seven security personnel dead.
title: Dog helped gather key evidence at Pathankot
